en: He must be from the South.
He explored the region around the South Pole.
He was tied to the tree with a rope.
He says he'll blow the story open.
zh: 他说他要把这事儿给捅出来。

en: He is a lion at home and a mouse outside.
He was curious to see the inside.
zh: 他挺好奇里面是什么样的。

en: He is introverted.
His shyness made public speaking a torment to him.
zh: 因为害羞，当众说话对他来说简直是种折磨。

en: He went to, where he heard the news.
zh: 他去了那儿，并在那里听到了消息。

en: He fell into the bottomless pit.
He ceased talking suddenly.
He suddenly stopped talking.
He got up suddenly and walked out of the room.
zh: 他猛地站起来，走出了房间。

en: He suddenly came out with the truth.
zh: 他突然把真相说了出来。

en: He passed away quite suddenly.
He burst into the room.
He gave up traveling abroad because of his sudden illness.
zh: 因为突然生病，他取消了出国旅游。

en: He died quite suddenly of heart failure.
zh: 他因为心脏衰竭突然去世了。

en: He suddenly took a liking to detective stories.
zh: 他突然迷上了侦探小说。

en: He made an abrupt departure.
He suddenly cut into our conversation.
zh: 他突然插进我们的谈话。

en: He was seized with sudden chest pains.
zh: 他突然感到胸口一阵剧痛。

en: He was suddenly struck with chest pain.
He suddenly rose from the chair.
zh: 他猛地从椅子上站了起来。

en: He came to suddenly.
He burst into tears.
He suffers from sudden fits of coughing.
He broke out into rage.
He sat reading, with his wife knitting a pair of gloves beside him.
zh: 他在那儿看书，他老婆在旁边织手套。

en: He complains of not having enough time to read.
He strained his eyes by reading too much.
zh: 他书看太多，把眼睛都看坏了。

en: He got tired of reading.
He is tired of reading.
He devoted himself to reading books.
He was completely engrossed in the book.
He was tired from reading.
He derived much pleasure from books.
zh: 他从读书中获得了很大乐趣。

en: He says that he will lend me the book when he is done with it.
zh: 他说他看完就把书借给我。

en: He can't read it.
He can't read.
He's unable to read.
He isn't able to read.
He wants a book to read.
He can neither read nor write.
He has more books than he can read.
He can read and write.
He has more books than he can ever read.
zh: 他的书多到这辈子都看不完。

en: He studied on his own account.
He studied on his own.
He found out the answers for himself.
zh: 答案是他自己找出来的。

en: He finished the work for himself.
zh: 他为了自己把活干完了。

en: He did the work on his own.
zh: 他是自个儿把活干完的。

en: He went into business on his own account.
He set himself up in life.
zh: 他在社会上立稳了脚跟。

en: He was put in a cell.
He made a speech using his unique tone of voice.
zh: 他用他那独特的腔调发表了演说。

en: He is a man of individual humor.
zh: 他这人幽默感挺独特的。

en: He is above all others in originality.
zh: 他在创意方面比谁都强。

en: He has a lot of original ideas.
He was opposed to monopolies.
He built the house for himself.
zh: 这房子是他给自己盖的。

en: He taught himself French.
He talked to himself.
He killed himself by taking poison.
He committed suicide by taking poison.
He was sent on a special mission to Europe.
zh: 他被派往欧洲执行一项特殊任务。

en: He never drinks save on special occasions.
zh: 除了特殊场合，他从不喝酒。

en: He never drinks except on special occasions.
zh: 除非碰到什么特殊日子，不然他从不喝酒。

en: He was sent abroad as a correspondent.
zh: 他被派到国外当驻外记者了。

en: He must have abused the privilege.
He abused the privilege.
He shows partiality to no one in particular.
zh: 他这人不偏心，对谁都一视同仁。

en: He is seriously competing with her in the polling score.
zh: 他在民调得分上正跟她竞争得不可开交。

en: He has an optimistic turn of mind.
He anonymously donated a large sum of money to the Red Cross.
zh: 他匿名向红十字会捐了一大笔钱。

en: He was crossing the street.
He crossed the street.
He was lacking in moral fiber.
He lapsed morally.
He was standing at the side of the road.
He was used as a tool.
He lives just across the road.
He may have lost his way.
He encountered a friend on the road.
zh: 他在路上碰见了个朋友。

en: He picked up cans in the street.
He was wounded in the body.
He is a man of vision.
He carries himself regally.
zh: 他举手投足间都有股王者气派。

en: He is popular among his colleagues.
zh: 他在同事里人缘儿挺不错的。

en: He planned the project along with his colleagues.
zh: 他跟同事们一起策划了这个项目。

en: He made the plan along with his colleagues.
zh: 他跟同事们一起制定了计划。

en: He is hardly friendly with his fellow workers.
zh: 他跟同事们关系处得不太好。

en: He is subject to the criticism of his colleagues.
He seems to have a habit of getting on his coworker's back when he makes a mistake.
zh: 他好像习惯了一犯错就爱找同事的麻烦。

en: He enjoys considerable standing among his peers.
He is a member of the board of the company.
zh: 他是公司董事会的成员。

en: He was destined to become a simultaneous interpreter.
zh: 他命中注定要当一名同声传译。

en: He stands out among the painters of his time.
zh: 他在当代的画家里出类拔萃。

en: He smiled to express his agreement.
He nodded as much as to say, I agree.
zh: 他点点头，那意思是他同意。

en: He keeps telling the same jokes over and over again.
zh: 他老是重复讲那几个笑话。

en: He repeated the same mistake.
He said the same thing over and over again.
zh: 他把同样的话说了一遍又一遍。

en: He kept on writing stories about animals.
zh: 他一直在写关于动物的故事。

en: He knows a lot about animals.
He loves animals.
He likes animals.
He is slow in action.
He is awkward in his movements.
He was unable to move.
He moves quickly.
He couldn't move and had to call for help.
zh: 他动不了，只好大声呼救。

en: He is not so old that he cannot work.
He is ready to work.
He holds a very enlightened attitude toward working women.
zh: 他对职业女性的态度非常开明。

en: There is no need for him to work.
He doesn't need to work.
He has ceased from work.
He is in the prime of life.
He is a hard worker.
He is a work horse.
He can die from overwork.
He worked and worked until he fell ill.
zh: 他拼命干活，结果累病了。

en: He ruined his health by working too hard.
zh: 他因为工作太辛苦，把身体搞垮了。

en: He died from overwork.
Overworking was the death of him.
He worked too hard, and became sick.
zh: 他工作太拼了，结果生病了。

en: He worked so hard that he ruined his health.
zh: 他工作太努力，把身体都搞坏了。

en: He worked so hard that eventually he made himself ill.
zh: 他干活干得太猛，最后把自己累病了。

en: He doesn't work, but only thinks of sponging off his relatives.
zh: 他不工作，只想着啃亲戚。

en: He not only does not work but will not find a job.
zh: 他不仅不干活，还不肯找工作。

en: He saves what he earns.
zh: 他把赚的钱都存了起来。

en: He often indulges in drinking when he should be working.
zh: 他经常在上班时间喝酒。

en: He is possessed of a strong fighting instinct.
He wanted to see a bullfight, but his father wouldn't let him go.
zh: 他想去看斗牛，但他爸不让他去。

en: He couldn't apply himself to his studies because of a headache.
zh: 他因为头疼没法专心学习。

en: He is suffering from a headache.
His head ached.
He had a headache.
He banged his head against a shelf and got a big lump.
zh: 他头撞到了架子上，起了个大包。

en: He hit his head against a rock.
He was dazed by a blow to the head.
zh: 他头上挨了一下，被打蒙了。

en: He held his head straight.
He fetched a few cushions to prop up her head.
zh: 他拿了几块垫子把她的头垫高。

en: He has the habit of scratching his head.
He is clever, but on the other hand he often makes careless mistakes.
zh: 他挺聪明的，但另一方面又经常粗心大意。

en: Bright as he is, he is slow in giving his opinions.
zh: 别看他聪明，但他发表意见总是慢吞吞的。

en: He has a nimble mind.
He stared at me from head to foot.
He is an intelligent boy.
He is a smart boy.
He's a smart boy.
He looked at her from head to foot.
He was wounded in the head.
He is an armchair theorist.
He is bright, and what is more, he is polite.
zh: 他很聪明，而且很有礼貌。

en: He is not in his right mind.
He is not witty or bright.
He is sharp-witted.
He is thick-headed.
He's intelligent, but I still don't like him.
zh: 他很聪明，但我还是不喜欢他。

en: He is bright, but he is not honest.
He attempted to escape.
He has a good brain.
He is intelligent.
He's intelligent.
He has a good head on his shoulders.
He had no other resource but to run away.
He had no choice but to run away.
He looked for every possible means of escape.
He had scarcely escaped when he was recaptured.
zh: 他刚逃走就被抓回去了。

en: He was desperate to escape.
He was not able to join in the discussion.
As soon as he arrived, he demanded a meal.
He had no sooner arrived than he was asked to leave.
He was watchful for any sign of diabetes.
zh: 他一直警惕着糖尿病的征兆。

en: He hesitated before answering.
He handed in his paper.
He handed in his answer sheet.
He was reluctant to answer.
He asked an awkward question.
zh: 他问了个让人尴尬的问题。

en: He answered, No.
He felt lost and uncomfortable.
zh: 他觉得很茫然，不太舒服。

en: He frowned in puzzlement.
He looked bewildered.
He is living with his friend for the time being.
zh: 他暂时和朋友住在一起。

en: For the time being, he's staying at a neighboring hotel.
zh: 他暂时住在隔壁的旅店。

en: He rented the garment for the day.
He is to stay here for a fortnight.
Does he live here?
He has few friends here except you.
zh: 除了你，他在这一带没什么朋友。

en: I took it for granted that he would keep his word.
zh: 我理所当然地以为他会守信用。

en: I took it for granted that he would stand by me.
zh: 我理所当然地以为他会支持我。

en: He took his own medicine.
He got what was coming to him.
He is in a fair way to being elected.
He has a good chance of being elected.
He has a good chance of being chosen.
There's a good chance that he'll be elected.
There's a good chance that he'll be chosen.
He said that he would be elected and that he would become governor.
zh: 他说他会当选，然后当上州长。

en: It was said that he had been sick in hospital then.
zh: 听说他那时候生病住院了。

en: He is said to have been the richest man in town at that time.
zh: 据说他那时候是镇上最有钱的人。

en: He seems to have been rich in those days.
He was regarded as the greatest writer of the day.
zh: 他被公认为当时最伟大的作家。

en: He blotted the good reputation of our school.
He cannot be relied on.
I believe that he's trustworthy.
zh: 我相信他这人挺靠得住的。

en: He did his duty as a matter of course.
zh: 他觉得尽责是理所当然的事。

en: He reported having seen the stolen car.
zh: 他报警说看见了那辆被偷的车。

en: He isn't the kind of person who steals.
zh: 他不是那种会偷东西的人。

en: He descended to stealing.
zh: 他居然沦落到去偷东西。

en: He was detected in the very act of stealing.
zh: 他偷东西的时候被当场抓住了。

en: He is capable of stealing.
zh: 他能干出偷东西这种事。

en: He is guilty of stealing.
He was fired for stealing.
zh: 他因为偷东西被开除了。

en: He is the last man to steal.
zh: 他绝对不会去偷东西的。

en: He recovered his stolen wallet.
He was surprised to find his stolen bag.
zh: 他很惊讶地发现自己被偷的包找回来了。

en: He is something of an expert on oriental art.
zh: 他在东方艺术方面也算是个专家。

en: He was interested in the mysteries of the Orient.
zh: 他对东方的奥秘很感兴趣。

en: He has studied the cultures of Eastern Countries.
zh: 他研究过东方国家的文化。

en: He is proud of having graduated from Tokyo University.
zh: 他为自己是东京大学毕业的感到很自豪。

en: He was transferred to the head office in Tokyo.
He graduated from Tokyo University.
He took the express for Tokyo.
He applied for a job with the Bank of Tokyo.
zh: 他申请了东京银行的工作。

en: He lives in the suburbs of Tokyo.
He went to the Tokyo station by taxi.
He left Tokyo for Kyoto.
He left Tokyo for Osaka.
He left Tokyo for Europe.
He visited me every time he came up to Tokyo.
zh: 他每次来东京都会来看我。

en: He was familiar with the roads of Tokyo.
He is at home with the geography of Tokyo.
zh: 他对东京的地形非常熟悉。

en: He keeps a store in Tokyo.
He lives in Tokyo.
He likes to live in Tokyo.
He moved to Tokyo.
He has been in Tokyo for a year.
He is longing to see my family in Tokyo.
zh: 他很想见我在东京的家人。

en: He is in Tokyo.
He's in Tokyo.
He carried on business for ten years in Tokyo.
zh: 他在东京做了十年的生意。

en: He started from Tokyo to Paris.
He lost the greater part of his fortune in speculation.
zh: 他因为搞投机亏掉了大部分财产。

en: He was frozen to death.
He froze to death.
He went skiing during the winter.
He was sick through the winter.
He was the first man to climb Mt. Fuji in winter.
zh: 他是第一个在冬天登上富士山的人。

en: He was the first man to climb Mt. Fuji in the winter.
zh: 他是第一个在冬天爬上富士山的人。

en: He longed for the winter to be over.
He tried to reform the party from within.
zh: 他试图从党内进行改革。

en: He was constituted representative of the party.
He took the leadership of the party.
He is one of the up and coming young men of the party.
zh: 他是党内很有前途的年轻人。

en: He was pinned down by a fallen tree.
zh: 他被一棵倒下的树压住了。

en: He hurt his left foot when he fell.
zh: 他摔倒的时候伤到了左脚。

en: He hurt his knee when he fell.
zh: 他摔倒的时候磕到了膝盖。

en: He looked black with anger.
He should be angry.
He is liable to shout when angry.
He's liable to shout when angry.
zh: 他一发火就容易大喊大叫。

en: He always yells at me when he is angry.
zh: 他一生气就对我大吼大叫。

en: He uses foul language whenever he gets angry.
zh: 他只要一发脾气就开始说脏话。

en: I thought he would be angry but, to my surprise, he smiled.
zh: 我以为他会生气，结果他居然笑了。

en: He was beside himself with rage.
He advanced on me fiercely.
zh: 他气势汹汹地向我逼近。

en: He could not control his anger.
zh: 他控制不住自己的怒火。

en: He couldn't check his anger.
He tried to restrain his anger.
zh: 他试图克制自己的愤怒。

en: He forbore his anger.
He suppressed his anger.
He exploded with anger.
He tried to hold back his anger.
He swallowed his anger and went on working.
zh: 他忍气吞声地继续工作。

en: He was burning with his anger.
He stood up with his hands trembling in a rage.
zh: 他气得双手颤抖地站了起来。

en: He was wild with anger.
He was prone to anger.
He snarled out his anger.
He ran out of the room in anger.
zh: 他气冲冲地跑出了房间。

en: He got out of the room in anger.
He was provoked into hitting her.
zh: 他被激怒得动手打了她。

en: He got angry and told off his servant.
zh: 他发火把仆人给训了一顿。

en: He gave an angry shake of his head.
He angrily rattled the locked door.
zh: 他气急败坏地摇晃着那扇锁着的门。

en: He banged the door in anger.
He was ablaze with anger.
I think he is angry.
He tried to soothe the angry man.
zh: 他试图安抚那个愤怒的人。

en: His blood is up.
I fancied that he was angry.
I thought that he was angry.
In spite of his anger, he listened to me patiently.
zh: 尽管他很生气，但还是耐心地听我说话。

en: He was angry, but he listened to me patiently.
zh: 他很生气，但还是耐心地听我讲完了。

en: He came out with an angry face.
zh: 他一脸怒气地走了出来。

en: He has the habit of standing up when he is angry.
zh: 他有个习惯，一发火就喜欢站起来。

en: He guaranteed his slaves' freedom.
zh: 他保证了奴隶们的自由。

en: He reached Kyoto on Saturday.
He distributed his land among his sons.
zh: 他把土地分给了几个儿子。

en: He doesn't go to the office on Saturday.
He holds a lot of land.
He has a lot of land.
He owns a lot of land.
He wants to dispose of his land.
He sold all his land.
He often comes late.
He mustered up his courage to talk to a foreigner.
zh: 他鼓起勇气跟外国人搭话。

en: He failed in his business in spite of his efforts.
zh: 尽管他很努力，生意还是失败了。

en: He spared no efforts.
He succeeded by virtue of his efforts.
zh: 他靠自己的努力成功了。

en: He succeeded by dint of effort.
He has made a fortune through hard work.
His efforts were attended with success.
zh: 他的努力终于有了回报。

en: With all his efforts, he couldn't succeed.
zh: 尽管他拼了命，还是没成功。

en: He failed due to lack of effort.
zh: 他失败是因为不够努力。

en: He was zealous in satisfying his employer.
zh: 他为了让老板满意特别卖力。

en: He is an expert in the area of city planning.
zh: 他是城市规划方面的专家。

en: For all his city ways, he is a country boy at heart.
zh: 虽说他一身城里人样，但骨子里还是个乡下孩子。

en: He is longing for city life.
He's never quite adjusted to the pace of the city.
zh: 他一直没怎么适应城市的节奏。

en: He'd love to live in the city.
He prefers the country to the town.
zh: 比起城市，他更喜欢乡下。

en: He avoided meeting her on the way.
zh: 他在路上躲着没跟她碰面。

en: He may have met with an accident on the way.
He may have met with an accident on his way.
zh: 他可能在路上出意外了。

en: He is bound to drop in on us on his way.
zh: 他顺路肯定会来看我们的。

en: He kept standing all the way.
He ate up his fortune by gambling.
zh: 他赌博把家产都输光了。

en: He cleaned out his saving on betting.
zh: 他赌博把存款全输没了。

en: He gambled and broke even.
zh: 他赌了一把，不赚也不赔。

en: He is a fine type of mountain climber.
zh: 他是个挺优秀的登山者。

en: He saw the accident on the way to school.
zh: 他在上学路上看到了那场事故。

en: He's accustomed to climbing mountains.
He's used to climbing mountains.
He's used to mountain climbing.
He's accustomed to mountain climbing.
He found it impossible to go there on foot.
zh: 他发现走路去那儿根本行不通。

en: He'll come on foot or by bicycle.
zh: 他要么走路来，要么骑自行车。

en: He hung up.
He went home as soon as he got the phone call.
zh: 他一接到电话就回家了。

en: He said he would give me a call, but he hasn't yet.
zh: 他说会给我打电话，但还没打。

en: He's talking on the telephone.
When he first heard her lovely voice over the phone, he fell head over heels for her.
zh: 第一次在电话里听到她那动听的声音，他就彻底爱上她了。

en: He let me know it by telephone.
zh: 他打电话把这事告诉了我。

en: He turns off the lights so as not to waste electricity.
He wanted to buy an electric typewriter but his friend talked him into buying a word processor.
zh: 他本想买台电动打字机，但朋友劝他买了台文字处理器。

en: He took the wrong train by mistake.
He forgot to turn off the light.
He may have taken the wrong train.
He loves trains.
He trod on my foot on purpose in the train.
zh: 他在火车上故意踩了我一脚。

en: He jumped on the train.
I fear that he may be late for the train.
I'm afraid that he might be late for the train.
I think that he might miss the train.
zh: 我觉得他可能会错过这趟火车。

en: He made room for an old man in the train.
zh: 他在火车上给一位老人家让了座。

en: He is apt to leave his umbrella on the train.
zh: 他老是把伞忘在火车上。

en: He entered the college to study electronics.
zh: 他上大学学的是电子专业。

en: He likes to take electric devices apart.
He goes to sleep with the lights left on.
He took his way to the country.
He headed out to the country.
He wandered about the country.
He has begun to enjoy country life.
zh: 他开始享受乡村生活了。

en: He has an estate in the country.
He dwells in the country.
He lived a rich and comfortable life in the country.
zh: 他在乡下过着富足安逸的生活。

en: He led a very peaceful life in the country.
zh: 他在乡下过着非常平静的生活。

en: He is leading an easy life in the country.
zh: 他在乡下过着悠闲的生活。

en: He lives all by himself in the country.
He had to commit the whole message to memory.
zh: 他得把整条信息都背下来。

en: He moved from place to place.
He is so much the worse for a change of air.
zh: 换了环境以后，他的情况反而更糟了。

en: He fell and hit his head on the floor.
zh: 他摔了一跤，头磕在了地板上。

en: He fell, twisting his ankle.
He got hurt when he fell down.
He scraped his knee in a fall.
zh: 他摔了一跤，把膝盖磕破了。

en: He handed the salesclerk the money.
He bought out a business.
He put a Closed sign on the front door of the store.
zh: 他在店门口挂了个“打烊”的牌子。

en: He disappeared into a dark corner at the back of the shop.
zh: 他钻进商店后面一个阴暗的角落里不见了。

en: He's gone to the shops.
He went to the store.
He sold his goods at a sacrifice to close down his business.
zh: 为了关门歇业，他亏本把货都处理了。

en: He is an expert in astronomy.
zh: 他是天文学方面的专家。

en: He dashed out of the store.
He was a great authority on astronomy, or the science of the heavenly bodies.
zh: 他是天文学，也就是研究天体的科学方面的权威。

en: It seems that he is interested in astronomy.
zh: 看来他对天文学很感兴趣。

en: He studies astronomy, or the science of stars.
zh: 他研究天文学，也就是研究星星的科学。

en: He is no less than a genius.
He is far from a genius.
He was reputed to be a genius.
It is not too much to say that he is a genius.
zh: 说他是天才一点也不过分。

en: He is not so much a genius as a hard worker.
zh: 与其说他是天才，不如说他是个很勤奋的人。

en: He is said to be a genius.
It may safely be said that he is a genius.
zh: 可以肯定地说，他是个天才。

en: It is no exaggeration to say that he is a genius.
zh: 说他是天才一点都不夸张。

en: He may be a genius.
He is a genius.
He took advantage of the fine weather to paint the wall.
zh: 他趁着天气好把墙给刷了。

en: He painted the ceiling blue.
zh: 他把天花板刷成了蓝色。

en: He looked up at the ceiling.
He bumped his head against the ceiling.
He is such a tall man that he can touch the ceiling.
zh: 他长得太高了，都能摸到天花板。

en: He wasn't tall enough to get at the ceiling.
zh: 他不够高，够不着天花板。

en: He hung a lamp from the ceiling.
zh: 他在天花板上挂了一盏灯。

en: He looked up at the sky.
He got assistance from above.
He is a typical Japanese.
He lived in a typical Japanese-style house.
zh: 他住在一个典型的日式房子里。

en: He's a typical workaholic.
He seems to be a typical American boy.
zh: 他看起来像个典型的美国男孩。

en: He dashed out like a bullet.
zh: 他像颗子弹一样冲了出去。

en: He was killed in a railroad accident.
zh: 他在一场铁路事故中丧生了。

en: He pried open the locked door with a crowbar.
zh: 他用撬棍撬开了锁着的门。

en: He thinks nothing of staying up all night.
zh: 他觉得熬通宵没什么大不了的。

en: He tried to study all night, but in vain.
zh: 他想通宵学习，但白忙活了。

en: He drinks a moderate amount of coffee.
He is a thorough-going egoist.
zh: 他是个彻头彻尾的利己主义者。

en: He darted a spear at his enemy.
He hit the mark.
He got even his opponents to agree to the new economic plan.
zh: 他甚至让他的对手也同意了这项新经济计划。

en: He did his best to overcome his enemy.
zh: 他尽力去战胜他的敌人。

en: He surprised his opponent.
He yielded the castle to the enemy.
He repented having betrayed his country to the enemy.
zh: 他后悔背叛国家投靠敌人。

en: He was badly treated at the hands of his enemies.
zh: 他在敌人手里受了不少苦。

en: He stood face to face with his enemy.
He denied that he was the thief.
He is alleged to have been a thief.
He is a thief.
He is a good loser.
He was covered with mud.
He did well to accept the offer.
zh: 他接受那个提议是对的。

en: He just brushed aside any objections to the proposal.
zh: 他根本没理会那些反对提议的声音。

en: He was proud of his brother.
He knocked his brother about.
He patted his brother on the shoulder.
zh: 他拍了拍他兄弟的肩膀。

en: She helped her brother out with his picture.
zh: 她帮她兄弟画了那幅画。

en: She helped her younger brother finish his picture.
zh: 她帮她弟弟画完了那幅画。

en: He asked his brother to execute his will.
zh: 他让他兄弟执行他的遗嘱。

en: He looked young beside his brother.
zh: 他和他兄弟站在一起显得很年轻。

en: He was mistaken for his younger brother.
He has a fear that his brother will fail.
He cut down a tree in his garden.
zh: 他砍掉了花园里的一棵树。

en: He walked across the garden.
He likes taking care of the garden.
He had his brother help him with the gardening.
zh: 他让他兄弟帮他打理花园。

en: He dug a hole in the garden.
He likes to work in the garden.
He found a ball in the garden.
zh: 他在花园里发现了一个球。

en: He grew potatoes in his garden.
zh: 他在自家花园里种了土豆。

en: He has taken to gardening.
He's an absolute fool.
He was sitting there.
He served without any serious errors until he reached retirement age.
zh: 他一直干到退休也没出过什么大差错。

en: He failed to come on time.
He didn't see the stop sign and almost hit the child crossing the street.
zh: 他没看见停车标志，差点撞上过马路的小孩。

en: He put live bait on a hook.
He cast his line into the lake.
He loves fishing.
He is fond of fishing.
He likes fishing.
He managed to cure himself of his habit of nibbling his nails.
zh: 他总算把咬指甲的毛病给戒了。

en: He paid double the usual fare.
He walked along the street.
He walked back and forth on the street.
He walked across the street.
He was nearly hit by the car while crossing the street.
zh: 他过马路的时候差点被车撞了。

en: He was standing at the street corner.
He was driving a car along the street.
He blushed when the girls whistled at him in the street.
zh: 街上的女孩子对他吹口哨，他脸都红了。

en: He always speaks to me when he meets me on the street.
zh: 他在街上碰到我总会跟我打招呼。

en: He picked up something white on the street.
zh: 他在街上捡了个白色的东西。

en: He was robbed of his money on the street.
He gave a momentary glance to the passers by.
He bowed to me as he passed by.
zh: 他经过时对我鞠了个躬。

en: He cleared the street of chestnuts.
zh: 他把街上的栗子清理干净了。

en: He was picked up by a passing ship.
zh: 他被一艘路过的船救了起来。

en: He nodded to me as he passed.
zh: 他经过时对我点了点头。

en: He had his sore arm dressed.
zh: 他把受伤的手臂包扎了一下。

en: He was painfully thin.
He yelled with pain.
He cried out in pain.
He was in pain.
He gave a loud cry with pain.
He drew a bead on a stag at bay.
zh: 他瞄准了那头走投无路的长角鹿。

en: He aimed at the cornered deer with his gun.
zh: 他拿枪瞄准了那只被困住的鹿。

en: He hit on a rare old book.
zh: 他偶然发现了一本珍稀古书。

en: He was, which was rare for him, in a bad temper.
zh: 他那天脾气挺差的，这对他来说挺少见的。

en: He's the deep brooding type.
zh: 他是那种深沉忧郁型的。

en: By intuition he knew she was lying.
zh: 他凭直觉就知道她在撒谎。

en: He is quick to take offense.
He came back soon.
He lost no time answering the letter.
He ordered me to leave the room at once.
zh: 他命令我立刻离开房间。

en: He soon recovered from the shock.
zh: 他很快就从惊吓中缓过来了。

en: He shot at the bird, but missed it.
zh: 他朝那只鸟开了枪，但没打中。

en: He studied the flight of birds.
zh: 他研究过鸟类是怎么飞行的。

en: He studied how birds flew.
He studied the way birds fly.
He likes to watch the birds fly above his head.
zh: 他喜欢看鸟在他头顶飞过。

en: He opened the cage and set the birds free.
He opened the cages.
zh: 他把那些笼子都打开了。

en: He rapidly ascended to the top.
He is from some small town in Nagano.
zh: 他来自长野县的一个小镇。

en: He has carried on his business as a builder for many years.
zh: 他做建筑生意好多年了。

en: He got his present position by virtue of his long experience.
zh: 他是凭着多年的经验才坐上今天这个位置的。

en: He's been having trouble with back pain for years.
He was a tall man.
He'll not live to make old bones.
He won't make it to old age.
He won't live a long life.
He seemed to have been working for a long time.
zh: 他看起来好像已经干了很久了。

en: He made nothing of working for a long time.
zh: 长时间工作对他来说根本不算什么。

en: He lives in Nagasaki.
He was born in Nagasaki.
He drew out his speech.
He must be very tired after a long walk.
zh: 走了这么远的路，他一定累坏了。

en: He can't stay long.
Though he long dominated the steel industry, he never achieved a complete monopoly.
zh: 虽然他长期主导着钢铁业，但从未真正实现完全垄断。

en: He made a long stay in London.
zh: 他在伦敦住了很长时间。

en: He was engaged in a long argument.
zh: 他卷入了一场漫长的争论。

en: He cut a poor figure after his long illness.
zh: 大病一场之后，他看起来很憔悴。

en: He has been sick for a long time.
He has suffered through a long period of illness.
zh: 他受了很长一段时间病痛的折磨。

en: He's writing a long letter.
He will stay here for a long period.
zh: 他会在这里待很长时间。

en: He was tired from his long walk.
zh: 走了那么远的路，他累坏了。

en: He was poor for a long time, but he is well off now.
zh: 他穷了好久，但现在挺有钱的。

en: He gazed at the ceiling for a long time.
zh: 他盯着天花板看了好久。

en: He hasn't written to them in a long time.
zh: 他好久没给他们写信了。

en: He was waiting for a long time.
He hit on the plan after long meditation.
zh: 冥思苦想了很久，他才想出这个计划。

en: He has not eaten a decent meal in a long time.
zh: 他好久没好好吃顿饭了。

en: He stayed at the hotel for a long time.
zh: 他在那家酒店住了很久。

en: He was silent for quite a while.
He was kept waiting for a long time.
He believes in the supernatural.
He kept me waiting for a long time.
He sang off key.
He is out of tune.
He knows a lot about butterflies.
He addressed the audience in a soft voice.
zh: 他用轻柔的声音对观众讲话。

en: He addressed the audience in a soft tone.
He is known to all the people in the town.
He is the talk of the town.
He is supposed to be the best doctor in the town.
zh: 他据说是镇上最好的医生。

en: I heard that he left town and moved east.
zh: 我听说他离开镇子搬到东边去了。

en: He showed me around the city.
He is richer than anyone else in the town.
He was acquainted with everybody in town.
zh: 镇上的每个人他都认识。

en: He lives in the western part of town.
He is known to everyone in the town.
He walked about the streets.
He got lost in the city.
He has a good reputation as a doctor in the town.
zh: 他在镇上是个名声很好的医生。

en: He runs a supermarket in the town.
He seized an opportunity to speak.
He tried to swim against the tide.
He came early in the morning.
He started early in the morning.
He's used to getting up early in the morning.
He's accustomed to getting up early in the morning.
He did not get up early in the morning.
He got up late and was late for school.
zh: 他起晚了，结果上学迟到了。

en: He makes it a rule to drink a glass of water before breakfast.
zh: 他习惯在早饭前喝杯水。

en: He is in the habit of taking a walk before breakfast.
zh: 他有早饭前散步的习惯。

en: He took a walk before breakfast.
He began to eat his breakfast.
He had a shower before breakfast.
He came down to breakfast.
He used to have bread for breakfast.
He didn't show up at the breakfast.
He is a bit of a grouch in the morning.
He set out at four in the morning.
He worked from morning till evening.
He does nothing but complain from morning till night.
zh: 他从早到晚就知道抱怨。

en: He works on the farm from morning till night.
He carried on working from morning till night.
zh: 他从早到晚一直在干活。

en: He worked from morning till night.
He continued working all day.
He works a lot from morning till night.
zh: 他从早到晚都在拼命干活。

en: He was given ten years and his wife three.
zh: 他被判了十年，他老婆判了三年。

en: He was as still as a statue.
zh: 他像尊雕像似的一动不动。

en: He added to his savings.
He put her savings to good use.
zh: 他好好利用了她的积蓄。

en: He set as his goal, the deposit of three million yen.
zh: 他的目标是存够三百万日元。

en: He was closely occupied with his writing.
He was accredited to the United States to represent Japan.
zh: 他被派往美国代表日本。

en: He has just been appointed the U.S. Ambassador to Japan.
zh: 他刚被任命为美国驻日大使。

en: He was just appointed as the American ambassador to Japan.
zh: 他刚刚被任命为美国驻日大使。

en: He was fined for illegal parking.
zh: 他因为违章停车被罚了款。

en: They fined him 5,000 yen for illegal parking.
zh: 他们因为违章停车罚了他五千日元。

en: He was appointed ambassador to Britain.
He is the magnet of attention.
He turned his mind to it.
zh: 他开始把心思放在这上面了。

en: He discharged his duties with care.
He blamed his son for being careless.
He bumped his head against a post.
He leaned against the pillar and gazed at the Statue of Liberty.
zh: 他靠在柱子上，望着自由女神像。

en: He sleeps by day and works by night.
He sleeps during the day and works at night.
He tried to make up for his lack of sleep by taking a nap.
He won't be home at lunch time.
He resumed reading after lunch.
He began to eat lunch.
He hit on the answer to the problem as he was having lunch.
zh: 他吃午饭的时候突然想到了问题的答案。

en: He smoked a cigar after lunch.
zh: 他午饭后抽了一根雪茄。

en: Did he have sandwiches for lunch?
zh: 他中午吃的是三明治吗？

en: He did not appear until about noon.
He goes to a part-time high school every evening in addition to the work he does during the day.
zh: 除了白天的工作，他每天晚上还上夜校高中。

en: He had to work hard day and night.
zh: 他得没日没夜地辛苦工作。

en: He faithfully discharged his duty.
He wants to make up and you should meet him halfway.
zh: 他想和好，你也该让一步。

en: He matched his gait to his companion's.
zh: 他配合着同伴的步调走。

en: He comes from the middle class.
He is man of moderate views.
He turned back halfway.
He can speak Chinese a little.
He speaks Chinese very well.
He is fluent in Chinese.
He is familiar with what is going on in China.
He is eager to go to China.
He wrote a lot of books on China.
zh: 他写了很多关于中国的书。

en: He is an authority on China.
He wrote a book on China.
zh: 他写了一本关于中国的书。

en: He had come back from China.
He has just bought a used car.
He deals in used cars.
He should have bought a used car.
zh: 他本来应该买辆二手车的。

en: He did nothing but read novels in his junior high school days.
zh: 他初中那会儿除了看小说什么都不干。

en: He entered junior high school.
He asked if I liked Chinese food.
zh: 他问我喜不喜欢吃中餐。

en: He asked if I like Chinese food.
zh: 他问我喜不喜欢中国菜。

en: He's back from his travels in Central Asia.
He dropped out when he was in the 7th grade.
zh: 他上初一的时候退学了。

en: He walked back and forth in front of the door, hesitating to enter.
zh: 他在门口走来走去，犹豫着要不要进去。

en: He stood up to go inside.
He liked history among others.
zh: 在众多爱好中，他挺喜欢历史的。

en: He was surprised to hear a cry from within.
zh: 听到里面传来的叫声，他吃了一惊。

en: He was walking up the hill at a steady pace.
He is particular about how he dresses.
He dashed the cup on the floor.
He has brown eyes.
He invented an excuse for being late.
He excused himself for being late.
zh: 他为自己的迟到道了歉。

en: I suppose he will be late.
He was always in hot water with his teachers for being late.
zh: 他总因为迟到被老师训。

en: He called in to say that he'd be late.
zh: 他打了个电话，说他会晚点到。

en: He is apt to be late.
He being late, we started without him.
zh: 因为他迟到了，我们就没等他，直接开始了。

en: He's desperately trying to make up for the delay.
zh: 他正拼命想把耽误的时间补回来。

en: He forgot to say he would be late, and to make matters worse, the traffic was bad.
zh: 他忘了说会晚到，更糟的是，路上还堵车。

en: He's afraid that he might be late.
He's worried that he might be late.
He left early in order not to be late.
zh: 为了不迟到，他早早就出门了。

en: He took a taxi to get there in time.
zh: 他打了个车，为了能准时赶到。

en: He managed to get there in time.
He made an apology to us for being late.
zh: 他因为迟到跟我们道了歉。

en: He apologized to us for being late.
zh: 他因为迟到向我们赔礼道歉。

en: He made many excuses for being late.
zh: 他为迟到找了一大堆借口。

en: He sent word that he'd be delayed.
zh: 他传话来说他会晚点到。

en: He got up late, so that he missed the bus.
zh: 他起晚了，结果没赶上公交车。

en: He stayed late and worked overtime.
He will be back by Monday at the latest.
He is to come here by six at the latest.
zh: 他最迟六点得赶到这儿。

en: He promised me to come by five at the latest.
zh: 他答应我最晚五点前到。

en: He will come back sooner or later.
He will fall ill sooner or later.
He will come sooner or later.
He'll know the secret sooner or later.
zh: 这个秘密他迟早会知道。

en: He will regret it sooner or later.
He is sure to become the President sooner or later.
zh: 他迟早肯定能当上总统。

en: He will tell everything to me sooner or later.
zh: 他迟早会把所有事都告诉我的。

en: He will tell me everything sooner or later.
zh: 他迟早会跟我把一切都说明白。

en: He'll make a good lawyer sooner or later.
zh: 他迟早会成为一名出色的律师。

en: He is late. Let's wait for him till 5:30.
zh: 他还没到，咱们等到五点半吧。

en: He suffered a fatal wound.
He was contemplating the water of the pond.
zh: 他正盯着池塘里的水发呆。

en: He called me from across the pond.
He saved a child from drowning in a pond.
zh: 他从池塘里救起了一个溺水的孩子。

en: He hung his head in shame.
He could not do so for shame.
zh: 他因为难为情没敢那么做。

en: He was too embarrassed to do it.
zh: 他太尴尬了，没好意思做。

en: He was too shy to do that.
zh: 他太害羞了，没敢那么做。

en: He turned red with shame.
He is too shy to bare his heart to her.
zh: 他太腼腆了，不敢向她表白。

en: He's shy, and never speaks unless spoken to. You have to talk to him.
zh: 他挺内向的，没人理他他就不说话，你得主动找他。

en: I like him all the better for his shyness.
zh: 正因为他害羞，我反而更喜欢他了。

en: He looked down in shame.
He blushed with shame.
He likes geography and history.
He drove over a land mine and his jeep blew up.
zh: 他的吉普车压到了地雷，被炸飞了。

en: He vividly depicted the confusion following the earthquake.
zh: 他生动地描述了地震后的混乱场面。

en: He is ready for an earthquake.
zh: 他已经为地震做好了准备。

en: He is the book critic for the local newspaper.
zh: 他是当地报纸的书评人。

en: He said that the earth goes round the sun.
zh: 他说地球是绕着太阳转的。

en: He believed that the earth was round.
He believed the Earth round.
He was suspected of underground action.
zh: 他被怀疑参与了地下活动。

en: He is a mere nobody.
He enjoys his position.
zh: 他很享受他现在的职位。

en: He doesn't have his feet on the ground.
He is not equal to her in intelligence.
He is a man of intellect.
In intelligence he is second to none.
He is in a rage to know.
He likes to posture as an intellectual.
zh: 他喜欢装出一副知识分子的样子。

en: He tried to parade his knowledge.
zh: 他想显摆一下自己的才学。

en: He has knowledge and experience as well.
He has character as well as knowledge.
zh: 他不仅有学问，人品也好。

en: He has experience as well as knowledge.
He has a well of knowledge.
He is acquisitive of knowledge.
He is the governor's longtime companion.
What he lacked in wit, he made up for in energy.
zh: 他虽然不够机灵，但干劲十足。

en: He is a man of wisdom.
He replied that he did not know.
He pretended to be ignorant.
He had no sooner heard the news than he began to cry.
zh: 他一听到那个消息就哭了起来。

en: He started crying right after hearing the news.
zh: 他听完消息后接着就哭了。

en: If he had known about it, he would have come.
zh: 要是他早知道，就过来了。

en: He behaved himself like a man.
He is a man of male courage.
He was bought up by his strong willed sister.
zh: 他是被他那个性格强势的姐姐带大的。

en: He ordered the boys not to shout in the classroom.
zh: 他命令那些男孩子不许在教室里乱叫。

en: He saw to it that both boys were well provided for.
zh: 他确保两个孩子的生活都有了保障。

en: He even suspected that the man was the principal offender.
zh: 他甚至怀疑那个人就是主犯。

en: He sawed logs for the fireplace.
He gave a firm refusal.
He has a warm heart.
He was so adamant in his refusal.
"No", he said in a decided tone.
He entered my room without permission.
zh: 他没经允许就进了我的房间。

en: He is anything but a gentleman.
zh: 他根本就不是什么正人君子。

en: He is anything but that.
He was wounded by a bullet.
He is quick of temper.
He died after a brief illness.
zh: 他得了一场小病就去世了。

en: He resumed his work after a short break.
zh: 休息了一会儿，他又开始工作了。

en: He gave a short talk.
He is absorbed in reading detective novels.
zh: 他看侦探小说看入迷了。

en: He is absorbed in reading a detective story.
zh: 他正专心致志地读侦探小说。

en: He could put together words from his word list, or spell out words letter by letter.
zh: 他能根据词表拼词，或者一个字母一个字母地拼读。

en: I could tell he was only pretending to read.
zh: 我看得出他只是在装模作样地看书。

en: He said it merely as a joke.
He did it simply out of curiosity.
zh: 他这么做纯粹是因为好奇。

en: He is nothing more than an egoist.
zh: 他不过是个自私自利的人。

en: He is nothing but a fool.
He is by far the best student.
He is as wise as any.
zh: 他跟谁一样都挺聪明的。

en: He is smarter than anyone.
Who is he like?
He will not listen to any of us; you might as well talk to a figure of stone.
zh: 他谁的话都不听，你还不如去跟石头说话。

en: He is humble towards everyone.
He is free and open with everybody.
Who does he look like?
He is as hardworking as any.
zh: 他跟谁一样都挺勤快的。

en: He is as diligent as any man alive.
zh: 他是这世上最勤快的人了。

en: He is second to none.
He is as honest a lad as any.
zh: 他是个再诚实不过的小伙子了。

en: He wouldn't let anybody interfere with his private affairs.
zh: 他不让任何人插手他的私事。

en: He is known to everyone.
He is popular with everybody.
He stole out of the house without anyone seeing him.
zh: 他趁没人看见偷偷溜出了房子。

en: He went out of the room without being noticed by anyone.
zh: 他悄悄走出了房间，谁也没发现。

en: He didn't see anybody.
He left the office without saying a word to anyone.
zh: 他一句话也没说就离开了办公室。

en: He promised me that he won't tell anybody.
He promised me that he wouldn't tell anybody.
He promised me he wouldn't tell anyone.
He makes himself agreeable to everybody.
He was very friendly to everybody.
He's nice to everybody.
Who is he talking to?
He is very slow at making friends with anybody.
zh: 他这人很难跟人熟起来。

en: He can make friends with anybody soon.
zh: 他很快就能跟人打成一片。

en: He was looking around as if he was expecting someone.
zh: 他东张西望的，好像在等什么人。

en: He will not get the job without someone to back him up.
zh: 要是没人挺他，他拿不到这份工作。

en: He is a scientist who is respected by everybody.
zh: 他是一位受人尊敬的科学家。

en: He is ready to learn anything from anybody.
zh: 他愿意向任何人学习任何东西。

en: He is only someone's stooge.
He'll make someone clean the room.
He made it clear who had said such a thing.
zh: 他挑明了是谁说的这种话。

en: Who is he?
Who's he?
He crowded the books into the shelves.
zh: 他把书都塞进书架里了。

en: He hit his head on the shelf.
He took the heavy box down from the shelf.
zh: 他把那个重盒子从架子上拿了下来。

en: He ran like a scared rabbit.
zh: 他像只受惊的兔子一样跑掉了。

en: Each time he escaped, he returned to this region.
zh: 他每次逃跑后都会回到这个地方。

en: He was arrested on charges of tax evasion.
He was accused of evading tax.
He escaped from prison.
He schemed to evade tax.
He's good at flying kites.
He made many costly purchases.
zh: 他花大价钱买了不少东西。

en: He was a general in the Second World War.
zh: 他是二战时期的一位将军。

en: He was knocked out by a punch in the first round.
zh: 他第一回合就被一拳KO了。

en: He threw away the race after rounding the third turn.
zh: 过了第三个弯道后，他把比赛给搞砸了。

en: He was a hero of the African campaign in World War II.
zh: 他是二战非洲战场的英雄。

en: He was thought to have been killed in the Second World War.
zh: 大家都以为他在二战中牺牲了。

en: He consumes an enormous amount of liquor.
He carved marble into a statue.
zh: 他把大理石雕成了一尊雕像。

en: He had ambition.
He is a very nice student.
He seems to be very sleepy.
He is very tall.
He was patience itself.
He was very patient.
He was very puzzled.
He came to school very late.
He ran too fast for me to keep up with him.
zh: 他跑得太快了，我根本跟不上。

en: He is such an honest boy that he never tells a lie.
zh: 这孩子老实得很，从来不撒谎。

en: He is a most important person.
zh: 他是个非常重要的人物。

en: He's a very important person.
He was very happy.
He was very excited.
He is a man of considerable influence.
He is such a lazy fellow.
He was too sleepy to read an evening paper.
zh: 他困得连晚报都看不下去了。

en: He was too sleepy to read the evening newspaper.
zh: 他太困了，根本没法看晚报。

en: He was a man of great ambition.
He surmounted the obstacles with great effort.
zh: 他费了好大劲才克服了那些障碍。

en: He won first prize as a result of his great effort.
zh: 凭着不懈的努力，他拿了第一名。

en: He appears to have been a great sportsman.
zh: 他看起来以前应该是个运动健将。

en: He felt very lonely.
He is a big shot.
He married a very pretty girl.
zh: 他娶了个挺漂亮的姑娘。

en: He is a man of great wealth.
He chose not to run for the presidential election.
zh: 他决定不参加总统竞选。

en: He made a hard run of the presidency.
zh: 他为了竞选总统拼尽了全力。

en: He visited Japan while he was President.
zh: 他当总统期间访问了日本。

en: He was nominated for the presidency.
zh: 他被提名为总统候选人。

en: He's working on the president's security detail.
zh: 他在总统安保小组工作。

en: He resigned as president.
Ought he to be forced out of the presidency?
He visited Japan in the character of President.
zh: 他以总统的身分访问了日本。

en: He is going to run for the Presidency.
He wants to run for President.
He will be named for President.
zh: 他将被提名为总统候选人。

en: He was elected president.
He was inaugurated as President.
He is close to the president.
He was placed in a key position by the president.
zh: 他被总统安排在了关键职位上。

en: He has a store on the main road.
zh: 他在主干道上开了一家店。

en: He made bold to speak to the King.
zh: 他大着胆子去跟国王说话。

en: He says daring things.
He gave a party on a large scale.
zh: 他办了一场很大规模的派对。

en: He is about your age.
He's about the same age as you are.
He's about the same age as you.
He dissented from the opinion of the majority.
zh: 他不同意大多数人的意见。

en: He was appointed Minister of Finance.
He came in spite of the heavy snow.
zh: 尽管下着大雪，他还是来了。

en: He went to Osaka on important business.
zh: 他去大阪办点儿重要的公事。

en: He spoke very loudly.
He laughed loudly, which behavior seemed inappropriate.
zh: 他哈哈大笑，显得有点儿失礼。

en: He called out for help.
He shouted defiance at me.
He cried out.
He never forgot his ambition to become a great statesman.
zh: 他一直没忘记想当伟大政治家的志向。

en: He never forgot his ambition to become a great politician.
zh: 他从未放弃成为一名伟大政治家的梦想。

en: He is a great politician, and, what is more, a good scholar.
zh: 他是个伟大的政治家，而且还是个很棒的学者。

en: He was surrounded by a crowd of pressmen.
He makes a fool of adults.
He is approaching manhood.
He will be a doctor when he grows up.
He wants to be a tennis player when he grows up.
zh: 他长大后想当一名网球运动员。

en: He resigned from the Cabinet.
He is just a minion of the minister.
He is a big eater.
He made his way to the minister.
He asked the general to take back his order.
He drinks like a fish.
zh: 他喝起酒来简直不要命。

en: He's a heavy drinker.
He drinks a lot.
He accomplished the great undertaking at last.
zh: 他最后终于完成了这项伟业。

en: He couldn't possibly part with his beloved dog.
zh: 他无论如何也舍不得离开他那只爱犬。

en: He ranges with the great writers.
zh: 他足以和那些伟大的作家齐名。

en: He is from Osaka, as is shown by his accent.
He lives in a small town near Osaka.
zh: 他住在大阪附近的一个小镇上。

en: He transferred his office to Osaka.
zh: 他把办公室搬到了大阪。

en: He went to Osaka, where he put up at a hotel.
zh: 他去了大阪，并住进了一家酒店。

en: He was born in Osaka.
He deals antiques in Osaka.
He chose to live in Tokyo instead of Osaka.
zh: 他没住大阪，而是选择了东京。

en: He carries on a small business in Osaka.
zh: 他在大阪做点儿小买卖。

en: He advanced to colonel.
He is a good carpenter.
He is a dramatist.
It is said that he is a millionaire.
He is said to be very rich.
I hear that he's very rich.
They say that he's very rich.
He is in the money.
He got a lot of money.
He acquired a large fortune.
He invested a lot of money in stocks.
zh: 他在股市里投了不少钱。

en: He put a large amount of money into the industry.
zh: 他往这个行业里投了大笔资金。

en: He left the office in great haste.
zh: 他急匆匆地离开了办公室。

en: He was banished to an island for high treason.
zh: 他因叛国罪被流放到了一个岛上。

en: He was exiled to an island for the crime of high treason.
zh: 他因为犯了叛国罪被处以流放海岛。

en: He's a late bloomer.
He addressed a large audience.
zh: 他面向大批观众发表了演讲。

en: He became a cameraman after he graduated from college.
zh: 他大学毕业后当了一名摄影师。

en: He has lived off his parents for ten years since he graduated from college.
zh: 他大学毕业后啃老啃了十年。

en: He was encouraged by a professor from his college days.
zh: 他受到了大学时代一位教授的鼓励。

en: He lived in Kyoto in his college days.
zh: 他上大学那会儿住在京都。

en: He is not so much a professor as a school teacher.
zh: 与其说他是教授，不如说他就是个老师。

en: He advocates reform in university education.
zh: 他主张进行大学教育改革。

en: He won't go on to graduate school.
He continued his studies at graduate school.
zh: 他继续在研究生院深造。

en: After he had graduated from the university, he taught English for two years.
zh: 大学毕业后，他教了两年英语。

en: He had graduated from the university and was always showing off.
zh: 他大学毕业了，总爱显摆。

en: He returned to Japan after graduating from college.
zh: 他大学毕业后回了日本。

en: He married directly after he left the university.
zh: 他一大学毕业就结婚了。

en: He has been devoted to the study of atomic energy ever since he graduated from the university.
zh: 他大学毕业以来一直致力于原子能研究。

en: He is fresh from college, so he has no experience.
zh: 他才刚大学毕业，还没什么经验。

en: He gathered men fresh from college and new to the business.
zh: 他召集了一群刚出校门、毫无经验的人。

en: He is fresh from college.
He's fresh out of college.
He entered the business world instead of going on to college.
zh: 他没上大学，而是直接进了商界。

en: He is reluctant to go to the college.
He was admitted to the college.
He found a good room with board near his college campus.
zh: 他在大学校园附近找了个管饭的好房间。

en: He depends on his parents for his university fees.
zh: 他的大学学费全靠他父母。

en: He is doing well in his college work.
zh: 他的大学功课学得挺好。

en: He was admitted to college.
He studied hard so that he might enter the university.
zh: 为了能考上大学，他学习很刻苦。

en: He studied hard in order to get into college.
zh: 他拼命读书，就是为了考上大学。

en: I wish he had gone on to university.
zh: 我真希望他当初上了大学。

en: He's saving up to go to college.
He's saving up to go to university.
He could not go to college.
It is necessary that he should go to college.
He's studying history at university.
He is studying history at the university.
zh: 他在大学里读历史专业。

en: He's studying history at college.
He's studying history in college.
He studies history at college.
He is studying law at the university.
He decided to specialize in physics at college.
zh: 他决定在大学里专攻物理。

en: He majored in Japanese literature at the university.
zh: 他大学主修的是日本文学。

en: He studied economics at college.
He majored in drama at college.
zh: 他大学主修的是戏剧专业。

en: He decided to major in medicine in college.
He made up his mind to study medicine at university.
zh: 他下定决心大学要学医。

en: He had to feed his large family.
He works hard to support his large family.
zh: 他为了养活一大家子而拼命工作。

en: He worked hard to support a large family.
zh: 他拼命工作好养活一大家子人。

en: He has a big family.
He's got a large family.
He called together everyone who was a captain and above.
zh: 他把所有上尉及以上级别的人都召集到了一起。

en: He has great enthusiasm.
He's a big liar.
He has great enthusiasm for golf.
zh: 他对打高尔夫球非常有热情。

en: He is not much of a companion for his wife.
zh: 他对他老婆来说不怎么算是个好伴儿。

en: He'll never amount to much.
He may just be ahead of his time.
zh: 他可能只是思想太超前了。

en: He's not much as a singer.
I don't think much of him as a musician.
zh: 作为音乐家，我觉得他水平一般。

en: He banged a big book on the desk.
zh: 他把一本厚书重重地摔在桌子上。

en: He was holding a large box in his arms.
zh: 他怀里抱着一个大箱子。

en: He is laboring under a great error.
zh: 他犯了个大错误，还一直执迷不悟。

en: He arrived in a big car.
He works in a big city hospital.
zh: 他在城里的一家大医院工作。

en: He has some grave defects, but I think he is a great scholar all the same.
zh: 他虽然有些严重的缺点，但依然是个了不起的学者。

en: He succeeded in the face of great difficulties.
zh: 面对重重困难，他还是成功了。

en: He succeeded in the face of great danger.
zh: 冒着巨大的危险，他还是成功了。

en: He was taken on by a large firm as a clerk.
zh: 他被一家大公司聘去当办事员了。

en: He came bearing a large bunch of flowers.
He has a large house and two cars.
zh: 他有一套大房子和两辆车。

en: He has a lot of ideas about running foreign workers.
zh: 对于管理外籍员工，他有很多想法。

en: He landed a big trout.
He satisfied his thirst with a large glass of beer.
zh: 他喝了一大杯啤酒解渴。

en: He yawned heavily.
He took a deep breath and tried to put his uneasiness to rest.
zh: 他深吸了一口气，努力压下心头的不安。

en: He grew up to be a college football player.
zh: 他长大后成了一名大学橄榄球运动员。

en: He grew up to be a doctor.
He grew up to be a very reliable man.
zh: 他长大后成了一个非常靠谱的人。

en: He is going to be a doctor when he grows up.
He exerted himself and made his way in life.
zh: 他努力奋斗，在生活里闯出了一片天。

en: He yawned widely.
zh: 他大张着嘴打了个哈欠。

en: He's running for Congress.
He was found lying unconscious on the kitchen floor.
zh: 有人发现他昏倒在厨房地板上。

en: He ran the risk of being caught and imprisoned.
zh: 他冒着被抓去坐牢的风险。

en: He proposed an alternate plan.
zh: 他提出了另一个替代方案。

en: I guessed that he was an ex-serviceman.
He took up gardening after he retired.
zh: 他退休后开始搞园艺了。

en: He took to fishing after retirement.
zh: 他退休以后迷上了钓鱼。

en: He resigned himself to spending a boring evening.
zh: 他只能认命，打算度过这个无聊的晚上了。

en: He carries a bag on his back.
He is coarse in manner.
He is a lazy student.
He was lazy and irresponsible. Thus, he was told to leave the company.
zh: 他又懒又不负责任，所以被公司开除了。
